body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

post.body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

body: I think part (but by no means all) of the backlash was in being labeled "offensive", which has such a negative, "unwanted-ness" connotation to it. I would certainly feel defensive first and open to discussion second if I were told by admins that my topics of choice were offensive. Why not a less subjective term such as "controversial"? Or is that just the snowflake in me trying to be soft-skinned about it?

post.body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

the smoking gun is the fact that admins will be setting an "offensive" category that will be hidden, and then reserve the right to "correct" the categories set by GMs

essentially a total walk-back of yesterday's "apology"

the "offensive" part, whatever you call it, also demands that you censor the content in your guild a certain way - you may set to have a guild on any category and just not censor content that may be offensive, and admins reserve the right to effectively shadow-ban your guild

"offensive" should not be a (sub)category on its own, nothing will set to be just that

\*typo

parent.body: I think part (but by no means all) of the backlash was in being labeled "offensive", which has such a negative, "unwanted-ness" connotation to it. I would certainly feel defensive first and open to discussion second if I were told by admins that my topics of choice were offensive. Why not a less subjective term such as "controversial"? Or is that just the snowflake in me trying to be soft-skinned about it?

post.body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.
post.body_html:

  • Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
  • All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
  • Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @Madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
  • Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will not be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

parent.body:
the smoking gun is the fact that admins will be setting an "offensive" category that will be hidden, and then reserve the right to "correct" the categories set by GMs

essentially a total walk-back of yesterday's "apology"

the "offensive" part, whatever you call it, also demands that you censor the content in your guild a certain way - you may set to have a guild on any category and just not censor content that may be offensive, and admins reserve the right to effectively shadow-ban your guild

"offensive" should not be a (sub)category on its own, nothing will set to be just that

\*typo

body:
well, should or should they not, they do

in fact, that isn't necessarily bad, it provides GMs with the ability to remove their guilds from the [Front Page](https://ruqqus.com/+TheoryOfRuqqus/post/643z/the-front-page) - but should not be also an admin-coercive measure which is what they seem to be gunning for

if they railroad these measures explicitly against users this is the end AFAIC

minor-friendly or normie-friendly content should be marked separately if at all

body:
I personally didn't have any issues with the politics filter. If political guilds are not turned off by default, this platform will never expand beyond being a right-wing echo chamber. People who are interested in other things will be scared off by the more...*Voat-like* posts on here. Hopefully the category system is just as good! 

...And no, I don't think that Ruqqus should be targeting the Reddit demographic. People on here obviously have thicker skin and value freedom of speech over so-called "safe spaces"...but that being said, not all of us want to read and post right-wing political stuff all day. We have other interests!

post.body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

body:
>We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". 

&

>Contrary to rumor, we will not be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Can you clarify this? If mis-categorisation is against the ToS and will result in a ban, it is still compulsion - whether or not the category is physically "locked" or not the result is the same.

Who decides what is "offensive?

Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT? **An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.
body_html:
We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds".

&

Contrary to rumor, we will not be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Who decides what is "offensive?

Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT? An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - manipulated - without their express consent.

Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.

post.body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

body:
> Can you clarify this?

Miscategorization won't result in bans, only in the category being changed to something more accurate and in line with whatever the purpose of the guild is.

> Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT?

Most categories will be on by default, with Political and Offensive being opt-in. Category selection is stored in a cookie, and we've ironed out the persistence issues in the first version of Categories, so one click is all it takes to change your selections.

>Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.

Uncategorized is now its own thing that can be shown in All if selected, yes.
body_html:
Can you clarify this?

Miscategorization won't result in bans, only in the category being changed to something more accurate and in line with whatever the purpose of the guild is.

Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT?

Most categories will be on by default, with Political and Offensive being opt-in. Category selection is stored in a cookie, and we've ironed out the persistence issues in the first version of Categories, so one click is all it takes to change your selections.

Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.

Uncategorized is now its own thing that can be shown in All if selected, yes.

parent.body:
>We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". 

&

>Contrary to rumor, we will not be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Can you clarify this? If mis-categorisation is against the ToS and will result in a ban, it is still compulsion - whether or not the category is physically "locked" or not the result is the same.

Who decides what is "offensive?

Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT? **An OPT-IN for any category leaves open the possibility a user is unaware their content is being censored - *manipulated* - without their express consent.**

Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.

body:
A reminder to users that you need to go to all and click "uncategorized" and opt in by checking it, to be able to see posts on all

also repeating a suggestion that maybe you could search for posts in all by category, or discover guilds by category

as well as, if you still want to refine how categories are organized, to model it after how libraries organize their subjects or [Wikipedia's overviews](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents/Overviews)
body_html:
A reminder to users that you need to go to all and click "uncategorized" and opt in by checking it, to be able to see posts on all

also repeating a suggestion that maybe you could search for posts in all by category, or discover guilds by category

as well as, if you still want to refine how categories are organized, to model it after how libraries organize their subjects or Wikipedia's overviews

body:
Ok, so certain categories (and uncategorized guilds) are still hidden by default, right? (At least for now.) I can't say that I'm a fan of having certain categories hidden by default with no easy way to tell just by looking at the page. I'm wondering, would it make sense to only make this categorization system apply to the "Home" listing for logged out users and a new listing for logged-in users? After all, the Home and Trending listings are currently the exact same for logged out users. I sometimes browse Ruqqus when logged out, and I don't want to have to check and uncheck categories over and over again when I decide that I want to see all of them or only see some of them. I'd also like /all to continue to show all guilds by default, since I don't know if users who are new to ruqqus are going to actually use the category system (at least in its current form), and I'm not sure if I'm going to bother with the category system if I'm going to have to constantly uncheck and re-check categories.

And as others have said, what's "offensive" is subjective, and I'm not sure if I quite like the idea of recategorizing guilds into that category. I myself don't have any suggestions regarding this though.

(Also, as others have suggested, there should be a "check all" and "uncheck all" option for each of the main categories and also for all the categories overall.)

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

post.body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

body:
I agree that there probably should be the option of turning off politics from the feed, but having it be off by default seems a bit much.

Ruqqus markets itself as a free speech platform, which is an intrinsically political stance. And most people who come to ruqqus presumably do so *because* of this political stance. So filtering out politics by default, when most people who come are going to be politically inclined, seems like a bad move.

So filtering out politics by default, when most people who come are going to be politically inclined, seems like a bad move.

parent.body:
I personally didn't have any issues with the politics filter. If political guilds are not turned off by default, this platform will never expand beyond being a right-wing echo chamber. People who are interested in other things will be scared off by the more...*Voat-like* posts on here. Hopefully the category system is just as good! 

...And no, I don't think that Ruqqus should be targeting the Reddit demographic. People on here obviously have thicker skin and value freedom of speech over so-called "safe spaces"...but that being said, not all of us want to read and post right-wing political stuff all day. We have other interests!

body_html:
One of the core tenets of freedom of speech is that all speech - and all users - should be treated equally.

Can you please explain how does having to opt-in to see speech deemed to be offensive factor into this?

parent.body:
> Can you clarify this?

Miscategorization won't result in bans, only in the category being changed to something more accurate and in line with whatever the purpose of the guild is.

> Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT?

Most categories will be on by default, with Political and Offensive being opt-in. Category selection is stored in a cookie, and we've ironed out the persistence issues in the first version of Categories, so one click is all it takes to change your selections.

>Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.

Uncategorized is now its own thing that can be shown in All if selected, yes.
parent.body_html:
Can you clarify this?

Miscategorization won't result in bans, only in the category being changed to something more accurate and in line with whatever the purpose of the guild is.

Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT?

Most categories will be on by default, with Political and Offensive being opt-in. Category selection is stored in a cookie, and we've ironed out the persistence issues in the first version of Categories, so one click is all it takes to change your selections.

Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.

Uncategorized is now its own thing that can be shown in All if selected, yes.

body:
While I don't agree with you, that's a fair way of looking at it. 

The sheer volume of political posts is what makes me apprehensive towards the idea of giving new users a full view, warts and all. It definitely gives the impression that this platform is exclusively for political content (or unapologetically *racist* content, if the Voattards are out and about). I don't see hiding content behind an easily accessible filter as an affront to the site's core values - but again, I can see why other people would think it is. 

Perhaps I'm a rare case, but I came to Ruqqus in June because the mods of non-political subs I was in began to pin messages in support of BLM. I voiced dissent, and got harassed for it. While it has been refreshing to be able to discuss Libertarian politics with others who value free speech, I'd still like to pursue my other interests on this platform. That hasn't really been possible, because everything is so overwhelmingly political...

body: There's certainly a more important conversation to be had here, but why are categories stored in cookies? Surely it's possible to make it a user setting? What with moving between devices, using incognito or having stricter cookie settings in browsers, having to reconfigure some 80 checkboxes every time is just plain annoying. I feel like given the site's nature, many would like to use it in a more private manner.
body_html: There's certainly a more important conversation to be had here, but why are categories stored in cookies? Surely it's possible to make it a user setting? What with moving between devices, using incognito or having stricter cookie settings in browsers, having to reconfigure some 80 checkboxes every time is just plain annoying. I feel like given the site's nature, many would like to use it in a more private manner.

parent.body:
> Can you clarify this?

Miscategorization won't result in bans, only in the category being changed to something more accurate and in line with whatever the purpose of the guild is.

> Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT?

Most categories will be on by default, with Political and Offensive being opt-in. Category selection is stored in a cookie, and we've ironed out the persistence issues in the first version of Categories, so one click is all it takes to change your selections.

>Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.

Uncategorized is now its own thing that can be shown in All if selected, yes.
parent.body_html:
Can you clarify this?

Miscategorization won't result in bans, only in the category being changed to something more accurate and in line with whatever the purpose of the guild is.

Will all categories be OPT-OUT by DEFAULT?

Most categories will be on by default, with Political and Offensive being opt-in. Category selection is stored in a cookie, and we've ironed out the persistence issues in the first version of Categories, so one click is all it takes to change your selections.

Will the "uncategorised" category show in ALL.

Uncategorized is now its own thing that can be shown in All if selected, yes.

body:
Pretty much. I don't care much if people know my political leanings. I'd rather not get beat to death in an airport when someone sees a redditor on ruqqus roleplaying a KKK member.

I'm glad a free environment is available. No one's stopping anyone from posting whatever the hell they want. You generally won't be banned for posting what you want.

I shouldn't be forced to read the screed by the tourettes patients, or the ones trying desperately to false-flag in order to leverage hosts to censor dissenting opinions. 

I should, however be able to easily read that stuff if, how, and when I want to.

body:
I posted this in another thread and I think everyone hear should see this as well

Let me be clear about a few things with categories

1. Categories IMHO are a "fix" to a problem that does not exist. In no way do I believe that any category should be applied to ALL or ALL sorted by NEW. We have already seen categories that are not weighted equally that prevent posts from being shown at all. There is no point to add additional filtering here when we as users can already do so with blocks. Remove the feature from this please.

2. If categories are to be used then only apply to home (maybe?) Or rework the guild search so that you can search guilds by the category chosen to find related guilds. This is now on each GM to categorize correctly if they want to be found in a search.

3. If something is to be deemed offensive then let us as users handle it. If we don't like it we should not have to view it. Admins can still deal with any ToS or unlawful violations.

4. For the home page, when not signed in, only show any admin moderated guilds such as +AskRuqqus or +Ruqqus. If a user is interested they can create an account.

  2. If categories are to be used then only apply to home (maybe?) Or rework the guild search so that you can search guilds by the category chosen to find related guilds. This is now on each GM to categorize correctly if they want to be found in a search.

  3. If something is to be deemed offensive then let us as users handle it. If we don't like it we should not have to view it. Admins can still deal with any ToS or unlawful violations.

  4. For the home page, when not signed in, only show any admin moderated guilds such as +AskRuqqus or +Ruqqus. If a user is interested they can create an account.

  • Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
  • Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
  • All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
  • Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @Madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
  • Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will not be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.
post.title: Ruqqus 2.29.3 - category improvements

I think people are overreacting when they say they are being censured. This is mostly to keep the frontpage of anyone checking the site for the first time from being flooded with alt-right shit while there is value to be had here and we should entice people to make an account and join in.

The people scared their "offensive" guilds won't show up in ALL or TRENDING will still see their posts there because they opted in to seeing that kind of content.

parent.body:
I personally didn't have any issues with the politics filter. If political guilds are not turned off by default, this platform will never expand beyond being a right-wing echo chamber. People who are interested in other things will be scared off by the more...*Voat-like* posts on here. Hopefully the category system is just as good! 

...And no, I don't think that Ruqqus should be targeting the Reddit demographic. People on here obviously have thicker skin and value freedom of speech over so-called "safe spaces"...but that being said, not all of us want to read and post right-wing political stuff all day. We have other interests!

post.title: Ruqqus 2.29.3 - category improvements

body:
Hm. My guilds that were previously classified as "Hobbies -> Niche" (the closest I could find) are now "Hobbies -> Skills". Strange! But given that we have a 10 guild limit it's not a big burden on anyone to recategorise.

Edit: but still. The categories are still both too fine-grained _and_ not granular enough. There's separate categories for PC and console gaming, and a whole category for wholesome memes (which will probably have exactly 1 guild), a category for "influencers", and a category for theatre (is there a _single guild_ that fits this at the moment?). Yet, nothing that even slightly fits some of the most active non-political guilds; there's no place for things that people find interesting like +aesthetic, +architecture, +infrastructure, etc.

body:
>One of the core tenets of freedom of speech is that all speech - and all users - should be treated equally.

This one. Having to opt-in to see content which is deemed to be offensive isn't exactly treating all speech equally, now is it? "Hate speech isn't free speech" is a bad excuse.

Don't get me wrong, I understand not wanting nazi spam. I don't really mind there being a category that you can turn off. But labeling it as "offensive" and turning it off by default discriminates that kind of political speech compared to other political speech.

Which is a violation of free speech as defined above.

body:
I keep seeing a lot of people whining about the whole offensive-category thing, comparing it to Subreddit quarantines, but I see a major distinction between the two. 

A quarantine meant that if your fucking heart beat was a half decibel too loud your entire subreddit is wiped and they put your account on a list. If all a Reddit quarantine meant was just "oh your content is too hurtful to look at normally so we're just going to make it a bit harder to see by accident" then there really isn't a problem: people who like the community keep participating, people who probably wouldn't like it don't see it, and people who probably would like it end up pointed towards it.

The whole "offensive category" thing is just like mods or admin marking nudity or gore or something else as NSFW when it is. Additionally, sometimes users know that their stuff isn't exactly clean to many people and can willingly say "hey this shit might make you or the people around you upset if you see it." 

Frankly, I welcome this specific concept as it makes the site more open to newcomers and allows for the entire community to grow in a healthy way. So long as the admins of Ruqqus don't start banning guilds for "offensive content," then the actual issue with getting quarantined on Reddit doesn't happen here.

>This one.

Well yeah, you're right that all speech isn't treated equally and that this isn't consistent with the above quote and it is discrimination against certain types of speech.

I define free speech differently and I don't see this as being a violation of it. And no, it isn't because "hate speech isn't free speech" BS.

I don't have a problem with it for the same reason I don't have a problem with NSFW content not showing when not logged in. +All is simply how the admins choose to represent this site. If they want fewer nazis and more "non-offensive" content, that's their choice. You can still freely express and people can find whatever within the legal limits of the US (which are thankfully very liberal), it's just that certain types of expression won't be used to represent Ruqqus.

parent.body:
>One of the core tenets of freedom of speech is that all speech - and all users - should be treated equally.

This one. Having to opt-in to see content which is deemed to be offensive isn't exactly treating all speech equally, now is it? "Hate speech isn't free speech" is a bad excuse.

Don't get me wrong, I understand not wanting nazi spam. I don't really mind there being a category that you can turn off. But labeling it as "offensive" and turning it off by default discriminates that kind of political speech compared to other political speech.

Which is a violation of free speech as defined above.

post.body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

Contrary to rumor, we will not be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

body: Many of us are here because we fled from sites that turned to shit due to abuse of admin/mod power. So it's pretty fucking scary to find out one of the only people with the power to censor you on this site took it upon himself to take control of a guild and apply a category that he unilaterally decided was "correct", presumably with no input from the other guildmasters, admins, or ruqqies of that guild. He didn't announce he'd be doing this sort of thing, nor explain why; there's no rule nor anything in the ToS that states this should happen. He just did it because he thinks he's right. Not a quality you want in an allegedly neutral arbiter of content.

body:
>We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". 

I look forward to the comprehensive and no doubt lengthy miscategorization guidelines, which are clear and unambiguous and can be applied globally in an objective fashion, as well as guidelines to determine the intent of the GM, since "deliberate" is a key part of that statement. This set of guidelines along with the moderation they entail are a *huge* undertaking while maintaining the free speech aspect of the community, in some ways making Ruqqus more akin to a publisher or content curator than a platform. Especially since we've already seen @captainmeta4 GM himself to a guild to apply the "correct" category of his own volition. 

But I'm sure there were hours of difficult deliberations with the admin team and the GM of said guild behind the scene prior to that action being taken. /s

Or I could be wrong and the admins don't give a fuck and the ToS will literally just say something like "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds" in which case the rule will be argued forever because of how vague and subjective it is. The admins would never be that retarded though. Right?

But I'm sure there were hours of difficult deliberations with the admin team and the GM of said guild behind the scene prior to that action being taken. /s

Or I could be wrong and the admins don't give a fuck and the ToS will literally just say something like "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds" in which case the rule will be argued forever because of how vague and subjective it is. The admins would never be that retarded though. Right?

body:
The problem is that this can have a big impact on how many people a guild can reach. That's the entire point of it infact. Overall, it just seems uncomfortably similar to reddit hiding conservative subreddits from the public eye.

I personally wouldn't really care that much about nazis being censored, but for some reason, I suspect that it won't end there. "Kill all jews" is definitely offensive. How about "Jews control most media outlets"? I guess it's weird people fixate on the fact so much, but it's technically true. Does it deserve to be hidden from the public eye?

How about pointing out +SpiritualBankruptcy? How about being +GenderCriticaI?

That's the thing with this sort of stuff. You never really know where it's going to end. Everything is offensive to someone. NSFW and NSFL are at least clearly defined. That, and they're usually not that political. No one is really crying over the loss of porn's contributions to the marketplace of ideas.

parent.body:
>This one.

Well yeah, you're right that all speech isn't treated equally and that this isn't consistent with the above quote and it is discrimination against certain types of speech.

I define free speech differently and I don't see this as being a violation of it. And no, it isn't because "hate speech isn't free speech" BS.

I don't have a problem with it for the same reason I don't have a problem with NSFW content not showing when not logged in. +All is simply how the admins choose to represent this site. If they want fewer nazis and more "non-offensive" content, that's their choice. You can still freely express and people can find whatever within the legal limits of the US (which are thankfully very liberal), it's just that certain types of expression won't be used to represent Ruqqus.
parent.body_html:
This one.

Well yeah, you're right that all speech isn't treated equally and that this isn't consistent with the above quote and it is discrimination against certain types of speech.

I define free speech differently and I don't see this as being a violation of it. And no, it isn't because "hate speech isn't free speech" BS.

I don't have a problem with it for the same reason I don't have a problem with NSFW content not showing when not logged in. +All is simply how the admins choose to represent this site. If they want fewer nazis and more "non-offensive" content, that's their choice. You can still freely express and people can find whatever within the legal limits of the US (which are thankfully very liberal), it's just that certain types of expression won't be used to represent Ruqqus.

body:
>I should be free not to be forced to read it.

And you're not. There's a very useful "block guild" button right there.

What is being proposed isn't the ability not to see offensive content. I'm not against a tag existing, which could be filtered out. I'm against it being done *by default*.

Because that's no longer protecting your right not to see what you don't want to see, that's outright suppressing some speech over other speech. You're right in the sense that that doesn't disallow certain speech, nor does it punish people for it, but it clearly *reeks* of censorship.

post.body:
The following changes will be made:

* Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
* Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
* All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
* Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
* Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will *not* be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.

parent.body:
>I should be free not to be forced to read it.

And you're not. There's a very useful "block guild" button right there.

What is being proposed isn't the ability not to see offensive content. I'm not against a tag existing, which could be filtered out. I'm against it being done *by default*.

Because that's no longer protecting your right not to see what you don't want to see, that's outright suppressing some speech over other speech. You're right in the sense that that doesn't disallow certain speech, nor does it punish people for it, but it clearly *reeks* of censorship.

Because that's no longer protecting your right not to see what you don't want to see, that's outright suppressing some speech over other speech. You're right in the sense that that doesn't disallow certain speech, nor does it punish people for it, but it clearly reeks of censorship.

parent.body:
>We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". 

I look forward to the comprehensive and no doubt lengthy miscategorization guidelines, which are clear and unambiguous and can be applied globally in an objective fashion, as well as guidelines to determine the intent of the GM, since "deliberate" is a key part of that statement. This set of guidelines along with the moderation they entail are a *huge* undertaking while maintaining the free speech aspect of the community, in some ways making Ruqqus more akin to a publisher or content curator than a platform. Especially since we've already seen @captainmeta4 GM himself to a guild to apply the "correct" category of his own volition. 

But I'm sure there were hours of difficult deliberations with the admin team and the GM of said guild behind the scene prior to that action being taken. /s

Or I could be wrong and the admins don't give a fuck and the ToS will literally just say something like "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds" in which case the rule will be argued forever because of how vague and subjective it is. The admins would never be that retarded though. Right?

  • Removal of the "politics" filter in user settings, since the category system makes it redundant.
  • Improvements to the way categories and subcategories are handled on the back end.
  • All categories and subcategories now displayed in alphabetical order
  • Reworked the category listing to be much more comprehensive. Thank you to @Madje for providing an excellent list of suggestions to work off of.
  • Addition of an "Uncategorized" category in the sidebar. This is for Guilds that have not yet selected a different category.

We are also updating the ToS to say "don't deliberately mis-categorize your guilds". That goes into effect tomorrow, 28 Dec 2020. Ruqqus is all about you deciding what you do or don't want to see, and accurate guild categorization is important to that.

Contrary to rumor, we will not be locking certain guilds into the Offensive category just for being offensive.

Note that we do intend to add the category filter to mobile; we just haven't yet.
post.title: Ruqqus 2.29.3 - category improvements

body:
Yeah, I get why it's potentially a problem and a slippery slope. The dillema for the admins is, whether they want to stick to their principles at all costs or have a nicer userbase and content.

Since they chose the latter let's just hope that they keep it on a reasonable scale (which I think an opt-in offensive category is).
body_html:
Yeah, I get why it's potentially a problem and a slippery slope. The dillema for the admins is, whether they want to stick to their principles at all costs or have a nicer userbase and content.

Since they chose the latter let's just hope that they keep it on a reasonable scale (which I think an opt-in offensive category is).

parent.body:
The problem is that this can have a big impact on how many people a guild can reach. That's the entire point of it infact. Overall, it just seems uncomfortably similar to reddit hiding conservative subreddits from the public eye.

I personally wouldn't really care that much about nazis being censored, but for some reason, I suspect that it won't end there. "Kill all jews" is definitely offensive. How about "Jews control most media outlets"? I guess it's weird people fixate on the fact so much, but it's technically true. Does it deserve to be hidden from the public eye?

How about pointing out +SpiritualBankruptcy? How about being +GenderCriticaI?

That's the thing with this sort of stuff. You never really know where it's going to end. Everything is offensive to someone. NSFW and NSFL are at least clearly defined. That, and they're usually not that political. No one is really crying over the loss of porn's contributions to the marketplace of ideas.

body:
> I put +Veterans under career for lack of a better option, though I did consider Sports--Combat, but shit, that alone is offensive

New GM of +Military here - I'm also wondering the same thing as I'm not sure what I should categorise the guild under. I have it placed right now under News/World just because quite a bit of the content is related to Military news, but there is also quite a lot of military related videos, photographs, history & discussion that gets posted which wouldn't be considered news. I think it might be worthwhile for the devs & admins to consider having a Military category, or tweaking the current categories to make a better fit for Military related Guilds.

I'll mention @arkitekt @kek @captainmeta4 here so they can see our feedback related to this.
